text:
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
E>egion II Conference
Williamsburg, Virginia
March 19-21, 1965
Tentative Program
FRIDAY, MARCH 19
10:00 a, m. - 6:00 p. m. Registration, Conference Center East Gallery
11:00 a. m. Meeting, Conference Committee, Room G-l, Lower Level
2:00 p.m. First General Session Virginia Room
Presiding: John Young, Director of Television, WUNC-TV,
Chapel Hill, N. C. - Conference Chairman
Welcome: Donald J, Gonzales, Vice President, Director of
Public Relations, Colonial Williamsburg
Program Review: James W. Sawyer,
College of William and Mary
Keynote Address: "Respectability in Broadcasting"
Harold Essex, President and General Manager,
WSJS-TV, Winston-Salem, N. C.
3:30 p.m. Meetings of N. A. E. B, Divisions
Radio: Room G-2, Lower Level
Presiding: Marjorie Newman, WFSU-TV, Tallahassee, Fla. ,
Director for Radio Division, N. A. E. B.
Reports: Jerrold E, Sandler, Executive Director, N. E. R.
John'Witherspoon, Project Director, E.C.S.
Television Stations: Room A, Main Level
Presiding: Howard Holst, Managing Director, WKNO-TV,
Memphis, Tenn.
Reports: Chalmers Marquis, Executive Director, E. T. S.
on "Station Interconnection";'Program Practices'
"Labor"; and "Federal Legislation. "
Lee Franks, Director, Georgia ETV Network,
on "State Commissions" and "2500 Megacycle
Service. "
R. Lynn Kalmbach, Director, South Carolina ETV
Network, on "CATV. "
John Young, Director of Television, WUNC-TV, on
"Status of the Copyright Legislation. "
Instructional: Tidewater Room, Lodge
Presiding: Roy J. Johnston, Communications Center,
University of Miami, Coral Gables
